repositories.citation: Hafen, Ryan. 'trelliscope - R Trelliscope package.' GitHub, v0.1.14, 2024. https://github.com/trelliscope/trelliscope
key_features: Interactive exploration of data frames of visualizations
repositories.architecture: Hybrid R backend (84.3%) with TypeScript/JavaScript frontend (15.7%) using React/Redux for interactive viewer
repositories.usage_example: ggplot(gap, aes(year, life_exp)) + geom_point() + facet_panels(vars(country, continent)) |> as_panels_df() |> as_trelliscope_df(name = 'life expectancy') |> view_trelliscope()
limitations: WebSocket server for dynamic panels requires httpuv

repositories.citation: Hafen, Ryan. 'trelliscopejs-lib - JavaScript viewer for Trelliscope displays.' GitHub/npm, v0.7.9, 2024. https://github.com/trelliscope/trelliscopejs-lib
repositories.architecture: Single-page React application with Redux state management, Material-UI components, crossfilter for filtering, and D3 for visualizations
repositories.usage_example: Accepts JSON specification with display metadata, panel information, and state configuration

common_patterns: R6 class-based object model for encapsulation
Vctrs for custom vector types (panel columns)
Separation of concerns: R backend, JS frontend
best_practices: Infer metadata automatically from data types
Support both pre-generated and lazy panels
Provide multiple panel sources for flexibility
Enable state persistence and sharing via views
Use key columns to uniquely identify panels
pitfalls: Panel key inference can be ambiguous
Mixing panel types requires careful handling
Large datasets need careful memory management
JSONP format needed for static hosting
File path sanitization critical for security
emerging_trends: Shift from trelliscopejs to modern trelliscope package
Integration with modern R tidyverse patterns

implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Use as_trelliscope_df() with pre-generated image URLs or ggplot panels
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Simplest approach with minimal configuration, automatic metadata inference

implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Use lazy panel generation with LocalWebSocketPanelSource
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Avoids pre-generating all panels, renders on-demand as user navigates

implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Pre-generate all panels, use FilePanelSource with JSONP format
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Enables GitHub Pages or S3 hosting without backend server

implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Use htmlwidgets with iframe panel type and local WebSocket
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Maintains interactivity while supporting complex widget dependencies

implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Build Python classes matching R6 architecture, generate compatible JSON, integrate with Plotly/Altair
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Reuses existing JS viewer, focuses Python effort on API design and data handling

Use in exploratory data analysis contexts
